questions.answer_description: For a class C network, a mask of 255.255.255.224 will allow for up to 8 networks with 32 IP addresses each (30 usable).
questions.question_text: Which subnet mask would be appropriate for a network address range to be subnetted for up to eight LANs, with each LAN containing 5 to 26 hosts?

discussion.content:
We can have only 1 access list per protocol, per direction and per interface. It means:
+ We can not have 2 inbound access lists on an interface
+ We can have 1 inbound and 1 outbound access list on an interface

questions.question_text: Which statement about access lists that are applied to an interface is true?

choices.A: You can configure one access list, per direction, per Layer 3 protocol
choices.B: You can apply multiple access lists with the same protocol in different directions
choices.C: You can apply only one access list on any interface
choices.D: You can apply as many access lists as you want on any interface

questions.question_text:
A network administrator is configuring ACLs on a Cisco router, to allow IP access from the 192.168.146.0/24, 192.168.147.0/24, 192.168.148.0/2,. and
192.168.149.0/24 networks only. Which two ACLs, when combined, should be used?

discussion.content:
access-list 10 permit ip 192.168.146.0 0.0.1.255
which covers the address block: 192.168.146.0 - 192.168.147.255

access-list 10 permit ip 192.168.148.0 0.0.0.255
which covers the address block: 192.168.148.0 - 192.168.149.255

questions.question_text: What can be done to secure the virtual terminal interfaces on a router? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
access-list 10 permit ip 192.168.146.0 0.0.1.255

which covers the address block: 192.168.146.0 - 192.168.147.255

access-list 10 permit ip 192.168.148.0 0.0.0.255

which covers the address block: 192.168.148.0 - 192.168.149.255

choices.C: Create an access list and apply to the virtual terminal interfaces with the access-group command.
choices.D: Configure a virtual terminal password and login process.
choices.E: Enter an access list and apply it to the virtual terminal interfaces using the access-class command.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

A technician has installed SwitchB and needs to configure it for remote access from the management workstation connected to SwitchA.
Which set of commands is required to accomplish this task?

choices.D: SwitchB(config)# ip router 192.168.8.254 255.255.255.0 SwitchB(config-if)# interface FastEthernet 0/1 SwitchB(config-if )# ip default-gateway 192.168.8.254 255.255.255.0 SwitchB(config-if)# no shutdown
choices.E: SwitchB(config-if)# interface FastEthernet 0/1 SwitchB(config-if )# ip default-gateway 192.168.8.252 255.255.255.0 SwitchB(config-if)# no shutdown A
choices.B: SwitchB(config)# ip default-network 192.168.8,254 SwitchB(config)# interface vlan 1 SwitchB(config-if)# ip address 192.168.8.252 255.255.255.0 SwitchB(config-if)# no shutdown
choices.C: SwitchB(config)# interface vlan 1 SwitchB(config-if)# ip address 192.168.8.252 255.255.255.0 SwitchB(config-if )# ip default-gateway 192.168.8.254 255.255.255.0 SwitchB(config-if)# no shutdown
choices.A: SwitchB(config)# ip default-gateway 192.168.8.254 SwitchB(config)# interface vlan 1 SwitchB(config-if)# ip address 192.168.8.252 255.255.255.0 SwitchB(config-if)# no shutdown
